snake-bite.title: Snake Bite
snake-bite.overview: India has the 'Big 4' venomous snakes (Cobra, Krait, Russell's Viper, Saw-scaled Viper). Immediate medical attention is crucial.

steps.title: Move to Safety
steps.desc: Move away from the snake. Do not try to catch it.

steps.title: Calm the Patient
steps.desc: Keep patient absolutely still to slow venom spread. Panic pumps venom faster.

steps.title: Immobilize Limb
steps.desc: Splint the limb like a broken bone. Keep it below heart level.

steps.title: Call 108
steps.desc: Transport to nearest hospital with anti-venom (PHC/District Hospital).

donts: Do NOT cut the wound or suck out venom.
Do NOT apply ice or tourniquets.
Do NOT give alcohol or pain killers.
snake-bite.indiaNotes: Common in rural/farm areas. Consult a doctor even for 'dry bites'. Snake stones are ineffective.

scorpion-sting.title: Scorpion Sting

steps.title: Wash Area
steps.desc: Clean with soap and water.

steps.title: Cold Compress
steps.desc: Apply ice pack (10 min on, 10 min off) to reduce pain.

steps.title: Monitor Breathing
steps.desc: Watch for difficulty breathing or swallowing.

donts: Do not consume alcohol.
Do not cut the sting site.
scorpion-sting.indiaNotes: Red scorpions (Maharashtra/South India) are more dangerous. Children are at higher risk of cardiac complications.

heart-attack.title: Heart Attack

steps.title: Call 108
steps.desc: Immediately call ambulance.

steps.title: Chew Aspirin
steps.desc: If not allergic, chew a 300mg Disprin/Aspirin.

steps.title: Rest
steps.desc: Sit down, stay calm. Loosen tight clothing.

steps.title: CPR
steps.desc: If unconscious and not breathing, start CPR immediately.

donts: Do not drive yourself to hospital.
Do not ignore chest pain.
heart-attack.indiaNotes: Heart disease is common in India. Sorbitrate 5mg under tongue can help if prescribed.

cpr.title: CPR (Adult)

steps.title: Response
steps.desc: Shake shoulders, ask 'Are you okay?'.

steps.title: Call 108
steps.desc: Get help/AED immediately.

steps.title: Compressions
steps.desc: Push hard and fast in center of chest. 100-120 beats/min.

steps.title: Breaths
steps.desc: 30 compressions, then 2 breaths (if trained).

donts: Do not stop unless exhausted or help arrives.
Do not be afraid to push hard.
cpr.indiaNotes: Good Samaritan Law protects you when helping.

choking.title: Choking (Adult)

steps.title: Encourage Coughing
steps.desc: If they can cough, let them try to clear it.

steps.title: Back Blows
steps.desc: 5 sharp blows between shoulder blades.

steps.title: Heimlich Maneuver
steps.desc: 5 abdominal thrusts. Pull inward and upward just above navel.

donts: Do not give water if airway is blocked.
Do not slap back if they are upright and coughing effectively.
choking.indiaNotes: Common with dry foods or talking while eating.

road-accident.title: Road Accident

steps.title: Secure Scene
steps.desc: Ensure no further danger (traffic). Turn off engines.

steps.title: Call 108/100
steps.desc: Report location and number of injured.

steps.title: Check Injuries
steps.desc: Check quietest victims first (may be unconscious).

steps.title: Stop Bleeding
steps.desc: Apply direct pressure to wounds.

donts: Do NOT remove helmets unless airway is blocked.
Do NOT move victim unless immediate danger (fire).
road-accident.indiaNotes: Under Good Samaritan Law, you are not liable for police questioning/legal hassle.

burns.title: Burns (Thermal)

steps.title: Cool Water
steps.desc: Run cool (not cold) tap water for 20 minutes.

steps.title: Remove Items
steps.desc: Remove jewelry/clothing near burn (unless stuck).

steps.title: Cover
steps.desc: Use cling film or clean plastic bag/cloth to cover.

donts: Do NOT apply ice, butter, toothpaste, or ghee.
Do NOT burst blisters.
burns.indiaNotes: Common during Diwali (crackers) or kitchen accidents. Seek doctor for burns > palm size.

dengue.title: Dengue Fever

steps.title: Fluids
steps.desc: ORS, coconut water, fruit juices to prevent dehydration.

steps.title: Complete Rest
steps.desc: Avoid physical exertion.

steps.title: Paracetamol
steps.desc: For fever/pain. Avoid Ibuprofen/Aspirin (bleeding risk).

donts: Do not take Aspirin or Ibuprofen.
Do not ignore bleeding gums/nose.

heatstroke.title: Heatstroke

steps.title: Cool Place
steps.desc: Move to shade or AC immediately.

steps.title: Cool Down
steps.desc: Spray water, fan the person, place ice packs in armpits/groin.

steps.title: Sip Water
steps.desc: Only if conscious. Give ORS or water.

donts: Do not give fluids if unconscious.
Do not give fever medication.
heatstroke.indiaNotes: Common in Indian summers (April-June). Loo winds.

food-poisoning.title: Food Poisoning

steps.title: Rehydrate
steps.desc: ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution) is key. Small sips frequently.

steps.title: Bland Diet
steps.desc: Khichdi, curd rice, bananas once vomiting stops.

steps.title: Medical Help
steps.desc: If bloody diarrhea or high fever, see doctor.

donts: Do not take anti-diarrhea meds without consult.
Do not eat heavy/spicy food.
food-poisoning.indiaNotes: Common from street food/water. Use bottled water.

dog-bite.title: Dog Bite (Rabies)

steps.title: Wash Wound
steps.desc: Wash with soap and running water for 15 MINUTES. Crucial.

steps.title: Antiseptic
steps.desc: Apply Betadine or alcohol.

steps.title: Vaccination
steps.desc: Visit hospital immediately for Rabies vaccine schedule (0, 3, 7, 14, 28 days).

donts: Do not cover wound closely.
Do not ignore scratch even from pet.
dog-bite.indiaNotes: India has high rabies burden. Stray dogs are common carriers.

chemical-burn.title: Chemical Burn

steps.title: Flood with Water
steps.desc: Wash with running water for 20 mins. Remove contaminated clothes.

steps.title: Eye Protect
steps.desc: If in eyes, hold eyelids open and wash continuously.

steps.title: Call 108
steps.desc: Seek emergency help. Identify chemical if possible.

donts: Do not use antidote chemicals on skin.
Do not rub eyes.
chemical-burn.indiaNotes: Industrial accidents or acid attacks. Also Holi colors sometimes cause reaction.

electrocution.title: Electric Shock

steps.title: Switch Off
steps.desc: Turn off main power source. Do not touch victim until power is off.

steps.title: Push Away
steps.desc: Use dry wood/plastic broom to push wire away if main switch inaccessible.

steps.title: CPR
steps.desc: Check breathing. Start CPR if needed.

donts: Do not touch with bare hands.
Do not use wet objects.
electrocution.indiaNotes: Common with water heaters, monsoon wires. Use rubber slippers.

gas-leak.title: LPG Gas Leak

steps.title: No Sparks
steps.desc: DO NOT switch on/off any lights or fans. No matches.

steps.title: Open Windows
steps.desc: Open all doors and windows.

steps.title: Regulator
steps.desc: Turn off gas regulator.

steps.title: Evacuate
steps.desc: Leave house. Call 1906 (LPG Emergency).

donts: Do NOT use phone inside.
Do NOT use electric switches.
gas-leak.indiaNotes: LPG heavier than air, settles on floor. Smell is 'rotten cabbage' additive.

drowning.title: Drowning

steps.title: Rescue
steps.desc: Throw rope or float (stick/wood/tube). Do not jump in unless trained.

steps.title: Recovery Pos
steps.desc: Place on side if breathing.

steps.title: CPR
steps.desc: Start CPR immediately if not breathing. Give rescue breaths first.

donts: Do not put yourself in danger.
Do not try to remove water from lungs by shaking.
drowning.indiaNotes: Common in monsoons, floods, and unauthorized swimming in rivers/dams.
